title: Overlap Problem
content:
Have a problem when strokes of my script typeface overlap...it inverts the shape where it overlaps. Any clues as to how to fix this? (See Attachment)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 1.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906195758/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%201_140.png) | 5.51 KB |

 [‹ Unicode](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906195758/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45642 "Go to previous forum topic") [Indesign CS3 and "use typographer's quotes" ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906195758/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45255 "Go to next forum topic")
author: cubanica

comments.content: Where is it doing that, in applications or in the design program? You may need to fix path directions, or it could just be a visual indicator in that tool to let you know where there’s overlapping. Hard to say what’s going on without more information.
It’s happening in CS. Doesn’t happen in FontLab.
i doubt it’s just happening in CS, check your path directions.
